definition:
The *Hermite numbers* $H_n$ may be defined by the generating function
$$\begin{aligned}
e^{-t^2} \;:=\; \sum_{n=0}^\infty H_n\frac{t^n}{n!}\end{aligned}$$ which
is same as the generating function of Hermite polynomials at the value 0
of the argument $z$. After expanding the left hand side of (1) to Taylor
series $1-\frac{t^2}{1!}+\frac{t^4}{2!}-\frac{t^6}{3!}+-\ldots$, one can
write $$\begin{aligned}
1-2\!\cdot\!\frac{t^2}{2!}+12\!\cdot\!\frac{t^4}{4!}-120\!\cdot\!\frac{t^6}{6!}+-\ldots \;\;=\; \sum_{n=0}^\infty H_n\frac{t^n}{n!}.\end{aligned}$$
Thus one sees that
$$H_0 = 1,\quad H_1 = 0,\quad H_2 = -2,\quad H_3 = 0,\quad H_4 = 12,\quad H_5 = 0,\quad H_6 = -120,\quad\ldots$$
Evidently, $$\begin{aligned}
H_n \;=\; 
\begin{cases}
\frac{(-1)^{\frac{n}{2}}n!}{(\frac{n}{2})!} \textrm{  when  } 2 \mid n\\
0\; \qquad \textrm{ when  } 2 \nmid n 
\end{cases}\end{aligned}$$ The Hermite numbers form the sequence ()
$$1,\,0,\,-2,\,0,\,12,\,0,\,-120,\,0,\,1680,\,0,\,-30240,\,0,\,665280,\,0,\,-17297280,\,0,\,\ldots$$
which obeys the recurrence relation $$\begin{aligned}
H_n \;=\; 2(1\!-\!n)H_{n-2}.\end{aligned}$$

According to (1), the Hermite numbers satisfy $H_n \,=\, H_n(0)$ where
$H_n(x)$ is the Hermite polynomial of degree $n$. The of Hermite numbers
and Hermite polynomials may be expressed also by using symbolic powers
$$H^\nu \;=:\; H_\nu$$ as follows: $$\begin{aligned}
(2x+H)^n \;=\; H_n(x).\end{aligned}$$ This means e.g. that
$$(2x+H)^2 \;=\; (2x)^2+2\cdot2xH^1+H^2 \;=\; 4x^2+4xH_1+H_2 \;=\; 4x^2-2 \;=\; H_2(x).$$
